posts.author: C1QP0X
posts.content: Well, I was wanting to start up a monk, any type is fine really so long as it gets the job done. I have little experience with playing monks and I tend to be a lone wolf on these PWs. Any suggestions and strategies for a highly soloable monk build for WoG?

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey man!

I play there as well. There are MANY POSSIBLE BUILDS and I can't stress that enough. I have one that I know could do OK, but you'd have to know how to use it to avoid getting dispelled. let me post it here:

Bigby's Small Hand Complex

With Cleric / Monk you can't go wrong, but on WoG there are LOADS of Dispel spammers. thankfully, you can approach them hidden thanks to HiPS. Buff up, hide, approach, KD, kill.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: There's also the build Valerfor just posted in the lvl 40 section. take a look!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Max's build is good, no matter if i hate getting dispeled and the low strength. It has Cleric inside nuff said. (like we say Intel inside).

Mine won't do if you want to really solo, you need a company till you starting get the real powers.

What you really need when you don't know a server by heart (where to find the right items in particular) is UMD. Can't stress that enough.

A while ago Max made a build for the BG2 Yoshimo, a mercenary from kara-tur. That one you need, i don't care, name him brother li or something. This is gonna let you solo almost everything.

Yoshimo --> fighter-wm-sd-build-t2349195.html

You can wait a bit for my Kensai build too but i would still propose that one.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Valerfor, why did you suggest a Fighter/WM/SD build, when the OP is asking for a monk build?

In a low-magic environment, an unarmed monk does more damage than a kama monk, unless you're also a cleric. Here's an unarmed monk that has UMD and Epic Dodge, too:

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hey Empyre.

My proposal was an attempt to show him the meaning of the UMD, especially in WoG. Whilst is true that there are charged items like Monk Gloves and potions that do almost everything that UMD does eventually, you need a very good knowledge of the server to do that. UMD for solo toons is that essential, at least till you get a firm grasp of the server. So i pointed him to a build that will make his life easier and has it all from UMD to trapfinding and HiPS to get away from dire situations since the new server rules regarding True Sight, but also a good offense from the very beginning.

WoG can be very harsh to the newcomers so i wanted to make him feel comfortable while learning the ropes.

Your build though is a very good alternative man, thanks for pointing that out. You could show him your unarmed specialist too.

Skilled Unarmed Specialist by Empire ---> http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 94155.html

And yes i do know that unarmed Monks can do a lot of damage of course. Especially in WoG where good kamas are almost unheard of.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Aye, that would be even better.

One minor thing, take 5 points from lockpicking and put them to UMD for a perfect 35 to use everything. You dont need more than 24 modofied lockpicking in WoG (counting the +10 lockpicks) to open up everything. Distribute the rest as you wish C1QPOX.

Now we are talking, this guys can curry his weight from the very beginning (and lots of loot) and has all the essentials too. Nice job Empyre.

posts.author: C1QP0X
posts.content: Ha. I just posted in Valerfor's thread with the Dim-Mak build and now I'm wanting to try Empyre's Unarmed Specialist as I tend to prefer a strength build. Thank you for the sound advice folks. I will be playing the unarmed specialist.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I would alter the spread slightly to gain two more feats in the Unarmed Specialist. Let me just say that I always go for level 40 power over playability, and being an experienced player, I CAN live with 2d6 less SA damage (especially in a STR monk) and with fewer skill dumps (zero UMD dumps pre-epic) and also fewer skill points, so I would go Monk 25 Rogue 3 Fighter 12 for 2 extra feats and the possibility to raise your BAB by 1 by going Fighter 8 Monk 12 pre-epic and taking the first Rogue level at 23. Then you'd have 3 UMD (23, 28, 38?) dumps and still loads of Monk levels to pump up your Tumble skill.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Max, your spread would have an experience point penalty, starting at level 23 when you take the first Rogue level. You play on PWs, where you spend most of your time at level 40, while I play in single-player, where I spend most of my time getting there.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:Max, your spread would have an experience point penalty, starting at level 23 when you take the first Rogue level. You play on PWs, where you spend most of your time at level 40, while I play in single-player, where I spend most of my time getting there.
Yeah, I know, but on WoG, which is mostly where I play, XP penalty is no biggie. May I ask you, when if at all are you planning to play online? I think it'd be a nice experience for you to have. It's TOTALLY different than SP modules in so many ways! You should give it a shot, man!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: There are multiple reasons I don't want to play NWN or any RPG online. I like being the big hero who saves the day, rather than just one among many. Also, the very idea of PvP in a RPG seems wrong to me. Also, I don't have the right kind of free time to commit to playing with other people online.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I have played a lot of single player campaigns long before i started played in WoG or Thain or GW or anywhere else.

All i have to say is that online playing have its own merits and unlike general MMO's Neverwinter's PW's are different and better suited to an RPG style of playing.


The excitement of conquering a difficult online persistant world in NWN far outclasses the feeling of any single player module in my opinion where after the initial foray you are stuck with the same thing more or less.

Gathering a small team of selected individuals and attempting a crusade into Lolth's demonweb pits while a DM is online and adjusts the module enemies on the fly is an experiance unlike any single player module,

one that will bring a sence of satisfaction and a smile to your face be it successful or not.


PvP is in most PW's out there upon agreement, nobody forces you to fight each other unless you want to.

My suggestion is to go and try a PW from the good ones in the list. You won't be dissapointed.
